products: Oracle Health Data Intelligence: PI Functional Reports

access.notes: Registered URL 301-redirects from /health/regulatory/certified-health-it/ to /health/certified-health-it/. Accordion 'Read more about EHI Export' must be expanded to reveal download links. Content is in the DOM (curl + grep works), but hidden by CSS.

export_format.description: Millennium EHR: SQL dump files (DDL + data) for MySQL or Oracle DB, packaged as ZIP. Multimedia Storage: original media files (DICOM, audio, video, images, PDFs). Document Imaging: scanned documents with XML annotation metadata (AxAnnotations.xsd). Longitudinal Plan: JSON files (5 files per patient covering health concerns, goals, activities, strengths, care plans). HDI: JSON based on Avro schemas via bulk extract API, downloaded through Data Syndication API.

documentation.total_extracted_size_description: ~165 MB extracted (three copies of 1,456 HTML data model reports plus PDFs and XSD)

clinical.evidence: Extensive coverage: clinical_events, charting, problem, clinical_reporting, clinical_trials, surginet, radnet, pathnet, womens_health, behavioral_health, social_history, structured_clinical domain sections. HDI entities include Condition, Procedure, Observation, MedicationAdministration, Allergy, Immunization, etc.

secure_messages.evidence: message_center domain with EMAIL_INFO, MSG_DOC_FAVORITES, MSG_FYI_ASSIGNMENT, MSG_FYI_FILTER, TASK_INTENDED_RECIPIENT, TASK_PUBLISH_QUEUE tables. Community (patient portal) domain with 17 pages of tables. SI_DIRECT_MESSAGE in system_integration.

billing_financial.evidence: charge_services (11 pages), revenue_cycle_core, revenue_cycle_config, collections (8 pages), scm_accounting, scm_contract, scm_purchasing, scm_transaction domain sections. Tables include CHARGE, CLAIM related tables. HDI entities include Claim, ClaimDiagnosis, ClaimStatus, BillingStatus.

insurance_coverage.evidence: authorization domain (4 pages), benefits domain, insurance-related tables throughout. HDI entities include BenefitPlan, BenefitPlanLite, Coverage-related entities.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: scheduling domain (15 pages), scheduling_build (23 pages), scheduling_orders_in (2 pages). SCH_ACTION, SCH_ACTION_DATE, SCH_ACTION_LINK, SCH_ACTION_LOC tables. HDI entity: Appointment.

documents_images.evidence: Four dedicated storage systems: (1) Oracle Health Multimedia Storage with DICOM XML structure documented in dedicated PDF, non-DICOM column definitions in separate PDF; (2) Oracle Health Document Imaging with full database schema PDF and AxAnnotations.xsd for annotations; (3) Multimedia content exported in original format (DICOM, audio, video, images, PDFs). Explicit statement: 'data from the Oracle Health Multimedia Storage location is maintained and exported in the original format.'

audit_trails.evidence: prologue domain (11 pages of tables) — 'Prologue' is Cerner Millennium's audit trail system. OMF_ABSTRACT_DATA_ST and related audit/tracking tables. Additional audit references throughout bedside_care, charge_services, clinical_events domains.

developer_guide_notes: The overview PDFs serve as developer/user instructions: Single Patient overview (4 pages) explains the ZIP structure, how to load SQL files into a MySQL database, and query the data. Patient Population overview (23 pages) covers all four storage systems in detail with appendices. HDI overview (3 pages) includes API authentication (bearer token / OAuth 1.0a), API endpoints for requesting and downloading exports. The Longitudinal Plan PDFs reference external docs at docs.healtheintent.com for JSON schema details.

downloaded_files.description: Single Patient EHI Export Data Overview and User Instructions — explains export process, ZIP structure, how to load SQL into MySQL
Single Patient format specs — contains Longitudinal Plan PDF + nested MySQL Data Model ZIP (1,456 HTML files, Millennium v2025.4.01)
Patient Population EHI Export Data Overview and User Instructions — covers all 4 storage systems, includes appendices for Multimedia Storage DICOM/non-DICOM and Document Imaging

Patient Population format specs — contains Oracle DB Data Model ZIP + MySQL Data Model ZIP (1,456 HTML files each), plus Document Imaging schema PDF, Multimedia Storage DICOM/non-DICOM PDFs, AxAnnotations.xsd, Longitudinal Plan PDF
HDI EHI Export Data Overview and User Instructions — covers API authentication (bearer token/OAuth 1.0a), Longitudinal Record Bulk Extract API, Data Syndication API for download

HDI EHI Export Data Format Specifications — Avro schema documentation for 124 unique Poprecord entity types (com.cerner.pophealth.program.models.avro.poprecord namespace). Covers clinical, billing, insurance, scheduling, and other domains via JSON/Avro format.

issues: Registered URL uses old path /health/regulatory/ which 301-redirects to /health/ — link should be updated in CHPL
Download links hidden behind accordion — not immediately visible on page load
Nested ZIPs require two rounds of extraction
Legacy 'cerner-corp' naming in file paths despite Oracle Health branding
Single Patient ZIP only includes MySQL data model (no Oracle DB version); Patient Population ZIP includes both
HDI Longitudinal Plan PDFs reference external documentation at docs.healtheintent.com for detailed JSON schema — a dependency on an external site
The 8-page HDI format spec PDF is 5.7 MB — unusually large, possibly due to embedded vector graphics or Avro schema diagrams
summary: Oracle Health provides exceptionally comprehensive EHI export documentation covering two distinct product lines. The Millennium EHR export is a full SQL database dump (MySQL or Oracle DB) covering 6,604 tables across 242 data domains, with field-level documentation (column names, types, nullability, definitions) in 1,456 HTML report files. Four storage systems are documented: core relational DB, multimedia storage (DICOM/non-DICOM), document imaging, and longitudinal care plans. The HDI export uses JSON/Avro format with 124 entity types accessed via REST APIs. All major EHI categories are represented including clinical data, billing/charges, insurance, scheduling, secure messaging, documents/images, and audit trails (Prologue). This is a genuine database-level export, not a FHIR re-export — the data comes as-is from the Millennium production database schema.
